class app.shared.auth.auth_handler.AuthController

Bases: app.shared.bases.base_model.ModelMixin

AuthController for common JWT Functions

classmethod token_response(cls, token: str, refresh_token: str)

The token_response function returns a dictionary containing the token and refresh_token. The function takes in two parameters, token and refresh_token. The function returns a dictionary containing the token and refresh_token.

Parameters

  • cls – Used to Set the class of the object that is being created.

  • token:str – Used to Store the token that is returned by the oauth2 server.

  • refresh_token:str – Used to Create a new access token.

Returns

A dictionary with the following keys:.

sign_jwt(cls: app.shared.bases.base_model.ModelType, claim_id: str, admin=False, refresh=False, claim_check=False, skip_verification=False)
classmethod decode_jwt(cls, token: str, admin=False, refresh=False) → dict

The decode_jwt function takes a token and checks if it is valid. If the token is valid, it returns the claims of that token. Otherwise, it returns None.

Parameters

  • cls – Used to Pass in the class itself.

  • token:str – Used to Pass in the token that is being decoded.

  • admin – Used to Determine if the token is an admin token or a user token.

  • refresh – Used to Determine if the token is a refresh token.

Returns

The decoded token as a dictionary.
